title: A Deadly Mass Shooting in Canada, and the Latest on the Search for Nancy Guthrie
summary: Plus, how extremist groups are using video games to recruit children online.

title: Students and Teachers Hid in School for Hours During British Columbia Shooting
summary: The shooting in Tumbler Ridge was one of the deadliest in Canada’s history. Seven people, including the suspected shooter, were found dead at the local secondary school.

title: Canada Launched Major Gun Reforms in 2020 After Its Deadliest Mass Shooting
summary: The country’s deadliest mass shooting, in Nova Scotia, led to the creation of a comprehensive program after 23 people died, including the attacker.

title: A Peaceful Mountain Town in Western Canada Is Shaken by Deadly Shooting
summary: Tumbler Ridge sits at the foothills of the Rocky Mountains in northeastern British Columbia, and is surrounded by expansive mountain ranges and a geological park.

title: Prosecutors Fail to Bring Charges Against Democrats Involved in Illegal Orders Video
summary: The rejection was a remarkable rebuke, suggesting that ordinary citizens did not believe that the lawmakers had committed any crimes.

title: Homeland Security Hires Labor Dept. Aide Whose Posts Raised Alarms
summary: A young aide behind social posts that echoed white supremacist messaging will help run social media for the much larger Homeland Security Department.

title: After Trump’s Cuts, Some Former Federal Workers Are Now Seeking Office
summary: A collection of former civil servants are waging first-time campaigns this year. Some said that President Trump’s attacks on the work force motivated them to run.

title: The Secret to Happiness May Lie in Our Social Skills
summary: A new book, “How to Feel Loved,” links our social skills to how content we are.

title: Trump Decries a ‘Nation of Renters’ but His New Policy Promotes One
summary: President Trump’s recently announced executive order that would bar big investors from acquiring single-family homes includes an exemption that allows them to build homes for rent.

summary: Matthew Goldstein, a reporter for The New York Times who has focused on the financialization of the housing market, looks at a new executive order on housing by President Trump.

title: Unemployment Rate in Focus as Fed Considers When to Restart Rate Cuts
summary: The latest jobs data, to be released on Wednesday, will shed light on how the labor market is faring, with vast implications for the Federal Reserve’s plans for interest rates.

title: Trump to Meet Netanyahu in Washington Amid Tensions With Iran
summary: It will be the sixth visit by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel to the United States to meet with President Trump since the president began his second term.

title: U.S. Brings Dozens of Foreign Military Chiefs to Washington
summary: The rare gathering focused on the Western Hemisphere underscored potential implications of the Trump administration’s “Donroe Doctrine.”

title: Iran’s Missile Program Tops Israel’s Concerns as Netanyahu Meets Trump
summary: President Trump is focused on Iran’s nuclear program, but Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu sees a more immediate threat from Tehran’s rapid rebuilding of its ability to launch missiles at Israel.

title: NATO Is Expected to Step Up Arctic Security. Here’s Why.
summary: As Russia displays military might in the Arctic Circle, the Western alliance is preparing a mission to increase its presence in that area.

title: Revelations in Epstein Files Lead to Resignations and Investigations Around the World
summary: Disclosures in documents released by the Trump administration have roiled the world, leading to resignations and the threat of legal charges far beyond American borders.

summary: What started as a rebuke of Dr. Attia has become a discussion about his credentials, longevity medicine and whom patients should trust.

summary: A Border Patrol agent shot Marimar Martinez five times, claiming that she tried to run him over. Newly released videos and text messages reveal fresh details about what happened.

title: Portland Lawsuit Alleges Tear Gas Use by ICE Is a Health Threat
summary: A novel lawsuit in Portland argues the chemicals are a health threat that have soaked into apartment walls, furniture and even children’s toys.

summary: In their first sit-down interview, Michael and Susan Pretti avoided recriminations and recalled the son that Michael called “an exceptionally kind, caring man.”

summary: In a courtroom in Ireland, prosecutors detailed the rambling, manic confessions of Henry McGowan, the New York man charged with murdering his father in a luxury hotel.

summary: This former military barracks in Bulgaria has become a symbol of the E.U.’s increasingly strict policing of its borders — and of what may come next.

summary: In her first interview about her father, the exiled Hong Kong activist Anna Kwok said the authorities were targeting her family to try to silence her.

summary: The designer revisits his heyday — and makes clothes you can wear.

summary: “A million times? There’s not even that many references to Hamlet in the play ‘Hamlet,’” Jordan Klepper said on “The Daily Show.”

title: Across the South, Residents Grieve for Thousands of Storm-Ravaged Trees
summary: The ice that fell during last month’s storm was unsparing: It decimated magnolias, oaks and other species in wealthy suburban enclaves, rural communities and urban parks.

title: N.Y.P.D. Officer Is Charged With Assault and Misconduct Over 2 Episodes
summary: Police Officer Quran McPhatter slapped a handcuffed prisoner and threatened a man who complained about the officer’s driving, prosecutors said.

title: Murdaugh Takes Appeal of Murder Convictions to South Carolina’s Top Court
summary: The appeal by Alex Murdaugh, once a well-connected member of a prominent family law firm, seeks to overturn his conviction in the murders of his wife and son.

title: California Man Sentenced to 4 Years for Covert Work on China’s Behalf
summary: The man, Mike Sun, corresponded with Chinese government officials, monitored the visit of Taiwan’s president to California and backed the election of a city council member, according to court documents.
